page.title: 16Housing in Bognor (general)
page.content: Bognor grew under the influence of Sir Richard Hotham during the 18th Century. In the 1920's there was a 'new town' scheme when many buildings were erected in 1922 a new residential area The Steyne was built with the houses having bow fronts and verandahs. In the late 19th and early 20th Centuries the town's modest expansion consisted of convalescent homes, two theatres and residential acommodation. Most of the houses directly surrounding the town were built between the wars. The town has continued to grow and has thus engulfed surrounding villages. This causes older houses to appear amidst new developments. Housing development continues.
